Reviews.Title: “Allright if you get it under 70 EUR :)”
Reviews.Author: Nitin_Teckchandani
Reviews.Content: Had a comfortable stay I booked it as i got it at a cheaper rate of around 60 EUR / night, i think its not worth the stay if they are charging 100 eur or more / night for a double room It is located few blocks away from rome termini so well connected by metro and buses , also my frnds suggested not to take any hotel too close to termini so that way this one worked out well Hotel has a very vintage old charm look and i was surprised to hear its only 10 years old as it looks very old Breakfast was quite fine actually with croissants coffee yoghurt fruits jam juices cereal milk Also they dont have free wifi and charge like 3 eur for an hour i guess

Reviews.Title: “Liz & Ian, UK”
Reviews.Author: Ian B
Reviews.Content: This is not a 4 star hotel, it is dated in terms of facilities and decor at best, and shabby at worst. The room was small, TV small and only 6 channels. The shower was so small you could not move or bend down. Mini bar? Yes if you call 2 bottles of water, one beer and a can of coke a mini bar! There were no drink making facilities which is poor when there is no restaurant or bar. The management could not supply a kettle to make a drink late at night. When I bought a flask to obtain hot water to make a drink, it was brought to the room 2 hours after the request at 1am, when we had fallen asleep. Service??? The next night we were told it was impossible to supply hot water. On a more serious note, the automatic fire doors were jammed open by fire extinguishers and heavy weights, as the magnetic releases were unserviceable. This meant that if a fire caught and set the alarm off the doors would not close and would let the fire spread. I will say, however, the location of the hotel was first class; near to the main rail and bus station and that I had a great weekend, just picked the wrong hotel in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: MickeSweden
Reviews.Content: A simple hotel, with a good location just a few minutes walk from Roma Termini. The hotel is a bit outdated and worn. Our room was very small but clean and acceptable. There is also breakfast included, it is very basic with bread, boiled egg, yoghurt and cereals, but it worked fine for us. The staff was helpful and pleasant and gave us good recommendations for restaurants up on request. All together; price, location, staff and breakfast included make this hotel to a very good budget stay for a couple of days in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: angela t
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for wedding anniversary and it is in good place to get around rome on the close transportation links, good staff at hotel and made us feel very welcome and helped us with any questions and recomended very good restaurant to us

Reviews.Title: “Not Recommended”
Reviews.Author: TravellersUs
Reviews.Content: This is NOT the 4 star hotel that it is written up to be. We would rate it as a 2 star at most. Having been closed for a month for renovations, we were one of the first guests at this hotel. The airconditioning has a preset minimum on it, which left us hot most of the time. The bed was reasonably comfy. The ensuite still had the previous guests empty shampoo containers in the shower and there was NO hot water, so a technician had to be called to fix it. There are no tea/coffee facilities in the room. Breakfast was not good. Wi-fi is an additional charge and did not work in our room, so we had to sit out in the hallway to get it to work. There is a lift to get you to your appropriate floor. Location was close enough to Termini for us to walk to and from with our luggage and there are a good selection of restaurants within walking distance. David on reception was very polite and helpfull. We will not return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4-star quality hotel but an average bed & breaksfast”
Reviews.Author: YAHP
Reviews.Content: This hotel is overrated and overpriced. It isn't a 4-star quality hotel but an average bed and breaksfast... no more than that. The double room was clean but really small, it came with a safety box that didn't work, the TV was very small too and with few channels, the Internet connection (€ 10/24 hours) run always very low, making impossible to use Skype, and the bathroom ceiling had a bad-looking hole (for ventilation purposes, I guesss). Also, the bedroom didn't come with tea facilities, and the water available in the minifridge came at a very high price. The breakfast was OK but not a 4-star quality one at any extent. However, the location was great: close to Termini Station and the city center but in a quiet area. The receptionists were also very helpful. I would recommend Champagne Garden but don't have great expectations based on what you read on its website. Otherwise, you're going to be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Ricardito85745
Reviews.Content: I was very lucky to find this hotel, within easy walking distance from the terminal. David at the reception desk was a great help for all things Roman, the room was comfortable and the breakfast was good. I look forward to staying here my next time in Rome...

Reviews.Title: “Average stay made worse by bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: Janiero
Reviews.Content: We were originally booked to stay at Hotel Prius but hey relocated us here due to their aircon not working. The hotel is close to Termini station which was great and our receptionist was lovely. Recommending a great place for dinner. The rooms have air conditioning, no free wifi and are all quite large and spacious. We were only here for one night and stayed in room 9. We unfortunately had a case of bed bugs where we couldn't sleep because of the itching and were bitten several times. Having to get an early flight the next morning made it all the worse. Not a great experience, but hopefully they Can sort out the issue with the bed bugs

Reviews.Title: “This small hotel was a good choice.”
Reviews.Author: Susan_Earl
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located on a quiet street close to the bus terminal with excellent choice of nearby restaurants. Our rooms were small but very clean. The price was reasonable & included a continental breakfast with many choices. The desk clerks spoke good English & were very helpful. We definitely recommend this neat little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: rzg
Reviews.Content: I did not plan to stay at this one, it was offered to my by the hotel reservations dest at the airport once my flight home was cancelled and I had to spend an extra 3 days in Rome. The room (single) was small but clean (great decor). The bathroom was reasnoble. Breakfast was good, and the staff very helpfull (and spoke fluent english, unlike many other places in Rome). The internet was not free (5€ for 12 commulative hours), but was fast and there were no connectivity problems I would certainlly recommend this one

Reviews.Title: “not more than 2 stars”
Reviews.Author: Michaelwzn
Reviews.Content: I booked a night with a sister hotel Hotel Champagne Park. Due to lack of wifi (however it was said to be there during my booking with Hotels.com) I was transfered to Hotel Champagne Garden which is on the other side of the Termini Station. The fact it is so closed to the station is probably the only good thing I can say about this place. The wifi is very expensive and must be paid separately on the top of the overpriced hotel room. The first room I was put in had a leaking radiator in the bathroom. A very rude receptionist refused to put me in another room unless he goes to the room and checks the leak. No apologies and after the inspection I was moved to a twin rather than a double room which I paid for. The floor in the bathroom of the new room was dirty and sticky. The walls in the room were dirty and seriously require a proper painting. I was afraid to complain as the receptionist was so rude already I did not want to end up with no accommodation in Rome at all. The room was overlooking something like a banquet hall from where, if I opened a window, someone could probably enter my room (fortunately they haven't had any events going on). The breakfast was poor and the coffee really disgusting. I have been to better 3* hotels than this 4* one. Avoid this place if you can!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: TSTraveller74
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, very close to Termini, the central station. You can walk to all the major sites in central Rome from Here. Friendly staff, and a very nice room, with a lot of soul. The hotel is rated as 4 stars. However 3 may be more like it. The breakfeast served was ok. The room was - when the window was closed very quite, no noise from the street.

Reviews.Title: “It was very good for the money.”
Reviews.Author: tuncaybe

Reviews.Title: “Not 4* but clean and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: samlPlymouth
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located for travelling around Rome. The only place we couldn't walk to was The Vatican. The rooms are very small and the shower was tiny but clean. To be honest I was quite disappointed when we first got there but soon got over it as you don't go to Rome to stay in the room. I would go back there again considering what we paid for it. We paid £144 for 3 nights inc breakfast. Breakfast was ok but would have liked toast. This hotel is definatly not 4*. One point to note was the minibar, I thought it was free as there's no mention of prices anywhere until you check out. If you are going to the hotel by coach or train then don't do what we did, we went to the top of the station and walked up the street, the hotel is at least half way up and in the August heat it felt miles away. The quickest way is to cut through the station and acroos the road, it takes at least 15mins of the walk. The staff were very helpful and always polite. We hardly heard any noise from outside so had a good nights sleep but the beds were very hard.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel but didn't feel like 4 star...”
Reviews.Author: ahy
Reviews.Content: OK hotel, nice personal and close to the train station. Didn't have the feel of a 4 star though.. And I have never in my life seen a dirtier shower curtin! Nice lobby and sitting area but the hotel rooms might need to be freshend up a bit.. One room we stayed in had such a small shower I could hardly turn around (I'm a slim 22year old), and one of the lists fell of the shower door... The breakfast was ok but a choice of bread would be nice. Area: Close to the train station and walk to coleseum. Quite central. Not on the big main road, but not far in some back alley either wich was good since the area around "termini" and the trainstation is a bit dodgy at night. Payed 80 euros a night incl. breakfast and thought that was good value for money. Wouldn't wanna pay more though. All in all: an OK hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: goworldmtl
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because it was close to the train station and I thought it would be easy to get there after a long flight. Not only was it easy to find but it turned out to be in a very good location. If you like to stay in a busy neighborhood, this hotel is not for you. But if you prefer a quiet area, this is it. Even though there are tons of hotels in the streets nearby, since there is no real touristy stuff to do here, it's very quiet at night. There are enough decent restaurants around. No gourmet stuff but ok. It's 5 minutes from the station and all the buses and the subway. Rome being a rather small city, you can walk from the hotel to the Colosseo in about 25 min. There is a supermarket just across the Piazza Indipendenza, if you need drinks or food. The internet is also a 2 min walk. And there is a good restaurant, Florian's, on the Piazza also. Good food, especially the pesto trofie! I don't know about the other rooms but mine was the smallest I've ever seen. I have to say that I was in shock when I first saw it but you get used to it very quickly and you don't go to Rome to stay in your room! Yes, it was small but the room was well equipped and it was fine for my needs. Don't expect anything modern, the decoration is quite dated and the walls need a fresh coat of paint. But everything was clean. If you're a bigger person, forget this place. I had to walk sideways to get to the toilet and the shower... The breakfast was fine for me. Not 30 choices of food but how much do you need? Coffee, croissants, cheese, eggs, salami, cereals, bread, Nutella, yogourt, more than enough. The staff was nice. It seems that the same guy works there 24/7 but apparently he's not fed ud, and always answers your questions, gives you map, tell you where to get the internet. The only things is that there is nowhere to sit outside your room (in my room, I couldn't sit at all except on my bed!). There is some kind of living room in the basement but it's not very inviting and I never saw anyone there even if the hotel was full. If you go to your hotel, you're in your room, period. Don't expect anything else. The bar they mention is not a bar. Barely a counter and if you want a drink, I assume you go get the guy at reception... I would go back to this hotel, hopefully in a bigger room. The location makes it perfect. If you're not too demanding, you will appreciate this place.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money - Great Location for Walking Rome”
Reviews.Author: Jen1234Toronto
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Garden Hotel for 7 nights March 23 to March 30th 2009. When we arrived at the train station in Rome we walked around the area and asked various Hotels their rates and availability. We did not book ahead as we figured we could get a better deal paying cash upon arrival. Keep in mind this is low season. We wanted to stay near the train station in Rome as we had planned some daytrips and wanted to avoid using any taxis to get to/from the train station to get back to the airport. We decided to stay at the Hotel Champagne Garden based on price. It says it is a 4 star hotel - but I would say it should be a 3 star. Nothing wrong with the place at all other than it might be a little dated inside. Breakfast is very simple, but really no issues as the price was right for us. So if anyone is looking for a clean, quiet, excellent location for walking Rome, and in an inexpensive place to stay in Rome, this would be the place.

Reviews.Title: “Give them a break!”
Reviews.Author: LucyandClive
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at Hotel Champagne Garden for 4 enjoyable nights in early November 2007. We were rather apprehensive before going as there were mixed reviews on the Internet about this hotel but the price and location sold it to us. We did not regret our choice. Contrary to other reviews, we found all the hotel staff polite and helpful including recommending restaurants and trips to do during our stay. The hotel is fairly small but very clean and we thought the room was more than adequate. My partner is a big guy but he was comfortable enough relaxing in the room and enjoying a soak in the bath after a long day strolling through the piazzas. The rooms are traditionally decorated but for us this added to the 'Rome' experience rather than detracted from the size. Breakfast does leave a little to be desired but its continental, what more can I say, its not going to be bacon and eggs and is certainly not USA style. We had a great few days in Rome seeing the sites and with the hotel ideally located near the Termini station but in the nicer quiet side instead of the rough side it was perfect to get out and about. We also thought the restaurants in this area were good value compared to other areas of the city but do visit Piazza Navona too as the cafes there are great, just stop and take in the vibe. Basically, don't just believe all what you read, give this place a go. We would be more than happy to go back should we find ourselves in Rome in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for these guys”
Reviews.Author: gurleylaw
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation based upon a reservation agent's statement that they had high-speed internet in the rooms. Nothing was explained to me about a cancelation policy. When I showed up, I found out that they meant that if you they meant you could connect to the internet only by dial up. There was no porter to carry my bags. I told them I did not want the room. The clerk was rude to me and said I was trying to cheat the hotel. He then went ahead and charged the full price for the room on my American Express ($187.00) . As I was staying at the hotel next door, I checked to see if Champage Gardens had any rooms for the night that charged me for canceling. They were competely full. So, they are attempting to double-charge for the room (once to the person who rented it and another time to me for canceling). When I tried to resolve the problem with the General Manager, she threatened me with legal action should I present my view of the situation on the internet. Don't stay at Hotel Champage Gardens. They are rude and the hotel is not a four-star as claimed.

HotelInfo.Address: Via Vittorio Bachelet 4, 00185 Rome, Italy
